question.instruction: Select the correct answer and click Submit.

Options.Option: 38 years old
Married
Initially presented at 36-weeks gestation in active labor
Gravida 5, Para 3205 (Full term 3, Preterm 2 [30 weeks, 36 weeks], Abortions 0, Live children 5 [includes birth of Baby Jazmine])
Prior births delivered vaginally
Obese (pre-pregnancy body mass index was 35)

question.instruction: Select the correct answer and click Submit.

Options.Option: Normal
Abnormal

OptionHeader.QuestionDesc:
Which of the following would you consider risk factors that could negatively impact her fetus?
Select all that apply and click the submit button.

question.instruction: Select the correct answer and click Submit.

Options.Option: Admitted to the Special Care Nursery.
He was placed on a nasal cannula after birth, but at 3 hours of age his respiratory distress worsened, and he was placed on nasal CPAP.
He remains on CPAP, and his cardiorespiratory status is stable.

OptionHeader.QuestionDesc:
Which of the following would you consider risk factors that could negatively impact her fetus?
Select all that apply and click the submit button.

question.instruction: Select the correct answer and click Submit.

Options.Option: Two days after admission, maternal symptoms worsen and the mother is diagnosed with HELLP (hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelets)
Antenatal corticosteroid dosing completed before delivery
Group B streptococcus screening negative
Cesarean section accomplished for maternal indications
Artificial rupture of membranes (AROM) at delivery – fluid clear
Apgar scores: 3 (at 1 minute), 8 (at 5 minutes)
Resuscitation: Dried, stimulated, poor respiratory effort so given positive pressure ventilation (PPV) for several minutes in the delivery room, then transitioned to CPAP
On room air with no CPAP required by 10 minutes of age
Held skin-to-skin briefly by the mother
Transferred to the Special Care Nursery at 15 minutes of age

OptionHeader.QuestionDesc:
Which of the following would you consider risk factors that could negatively impact her fetus?
Select all that apply and click the submit button.

question.instruction: Select the correct answer and click Submit.

Options.Option: Mother reports leaking of amniotic fluid for the past week.
Onset of preterm labor 6 hours before admission.
Fetal heart tracing: Category 1 (normal tracing and normal fetal heart rate and variability).
Highest intrapartum maternal temperature 37.5°C.
Amniotic fluid foul-smelling.
Vaginal delivery 2 hours after admission.
Apgar scores: 7 (at 1 minute), 9 (at 5 minutes).
Resuscitation: Neonatal resuscitation steps followed; dried and stimulated.

Laid on mother’s chest for skin-to-skin holding, then remained with mother and
transferred to mother-baby unit.
